intro: Solenostemon lateriticola, commonly known as the lateritic strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or lateritic soils, adapting to nutrient-poor environments. Its leaves are often lance-shaped with a rough texture, and it produces small, tubular flowers in clusters. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
